Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i added a handy tx/sec printout

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the epochs are every 5 minutes and it maps each peer it sees to a unique bit position

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: max of 1024 peers per epoch

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this is to mitigate sybil attack, though still a determined attacker can fill up a lot of peer spots, so it isnt perfect, but it at least allows new peer sets every 5 minutes and allows for future attack mitigations

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: most of what i added was actually parsing the hex string for the broadcast, but to make it more useful added tagA, tagB and destpubkey, which allows the future implementations of lookups instant

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: still havent debugged that yet

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: also added the concept of a priority for a tx, so the more important it is, the longer it takes to create

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: with the priority, then nodes can prioritize which ones to route, which ones to ping about and combined with local "subscriptions" to tags, will allow for much better packet traffic control

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: getting all this fully implemented and debugged will take more than 5 more days though. one step at a time, i need to fix a traffic congestion problem and then onto debugging the tags
